page.title: 01An introduction to Bexhill
page.content: Bexhill-on-Sea is{positioned}on the S.E. coast of England, and mid-way between Eastbourne to the west and Hastings to the East. It is located on a spur of sandstone that ends in the sea as a small cliff to the East of the town called Galley Hill, with low floodable marshes to the east (Glynde Gap) and to the west (Pevensey Marshes). {Climatically}Bexhill enjoys warm summers (17C July) and mild winters (5C January) due to the maritime influence of the sea. The{population}of the area is approximately 36000 with a pronounced age imbalance, the average age being 66. Bexhill is essentially a{tourist {and retirement centre,}and derives most of its wealth from these. There is a little light industry and local government offices for Rother District
